remarks: The property for two triangles to be congruent to each other. (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 3-Apr-2019.)
statement:
trgcgrg.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
trgcgrg.m $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
trgcgrg.r $e |- .~ = ( cgrG ` G ) $.
trgcgrg.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
trgcgrg.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
trgcgrg.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
trgcgrg.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
trgcgrg.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. P ) $.
trgcgrg.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. P ) $.
trgcgrg.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. P ) $.
trgcgrg $p |- ( ph -> ( <" A B C "> .~ <" D E F "> <-> ( ( A .- B ) = ( D .- E ) /\ ( B .- C ) = ( E .- F ) /\ ( C .- A ) = ( F .- D ) ) ) ) $.
